WRITING.TITLE: So I finally beat Candy Crush

WRITING.TEXT:
Word = poopknuckles. I made it up and it makes me smile.
Phrase = "Be excellent to each other and PARTY ON DUDES!" - Abraham Lincoln.....from Bill and Ted. Kinda sums up what I think life is all about. Just be a great person to one another and have a good time. It's the only life we got so enjoy it.

Some of the episodes are very well written. Silence in the Library. There's one about Hell that's pretty dope. They have their moments. The Christmas episodes are always fun. My favorite is The Christmas Carol. I think it's in the 6 season and it's by far the best version of A Christmas Carol ever. All in all its a fun Sci-fi show to watch.

Yes. The writing on the original Animated Series was great (Mark Hamill is the voice of the Joker. All Batman fans agree HE is Joker. Also the voice in the Arkham games). Plus the movies are phenomenal. The Mask of the Phantasm, Batman: Under the Red Hood, Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker. These are all great movies derived from the original show.

I love it here. Though it gets hot as balls, it has a little bit of everything. I'd love to go to NY sometimes. I have friends who go there for the shows. Plus I love Wu-Tang, B.I.G., Beastie Boys, Busta Rhymes, KRS-One, Rakim, and a bunch of other hip hop legends.
Batman = both/Game of Thrones = show but would like to get into the books
You make me smile.
Dallas, TX. you?
Fall. (idk what the question was but it IS Fall right now and it IS my favorite season.)
Thanks for the tips!

WRITING.TITLE: [INTRO] Greetings! subject901 here for the first time!
WRITING.TEXT:
I just stumbled upon this subreddit. It's my new favorite b/c it shows how awesome people can be to a total stranger. This restores my "faith" in humanity.
I did my first contest a few minutes ago and I'll see how well I did on Nov. 1st. Had to describe how I almost burnt down my house while cooking one strip of bacon.
There are three things I like (not entirely but you get the idea): Batman, Doctor Who, and Game of Thrones. These things bring me closer to different family members and friends. That, and Firefly. 4 things.
This was just me saying HI to everyone here and thank you for bringing happiness to others! True meaning of life.

When I was 15, I loved bacon (I still do). No one told me how to make bacon. All I knew was you put it in a skillet and it magically becomes the greatest food ever. One summer, both parents were gone and I was at home alone with my little sister who was 9 or 10 years old at the time. To show my sister how awesome her big brother was, I decided to do some BIG CHEFIN' make some bacon. Well, I had never done it before (and this was near the beginning of the internet so there wasn't any quick searches on YouTube or asking fellow Redditors) so I just started with making one strip of bacon. JUST ONE. About 5 minutes later, the entire kitchen was filled with smoke! I quickly opened the back door and a few windows to get the smoke out. The lonely strip of bacon look like leather. To make matters worse, like an idiot in a panic, I quickly poured the grease in the trash can. It was still hot enough to melt through the bag and trash can. I had a lot of explaining to do to my parents when they got home....and no bacon. Truly a sad story.
http://www.amazon.com/Trader-Iphone-Protective-Copper-Aluminum/dp/B009JRC0YE/ref=sr_1_70?ie=UTF8 qid=1382367444 sr=8-70 keywords=Batman
Pretty soon your friends and family will force you to watch Intervention
Whoa?

My buddy got a hold of some old VHS two weeks ago and I got to watch The Godfather for the first time. Talk about epic! Brando was incredible and it took me a while to realize that that was a very young DeNiro. Truly one of the best movies ever.....that and Blazing Saddles.

Hey Penn! First off I wanted to say that you are in fact a really nice guy. I got to have dinner with you once and you and Emily are great people. My brother Michael used to work at Opportunity Village a while back and everything that that non-profit does is amazing.
Just a couple random questions:
1) What's your favorite bass line to play?
2) Do people still ask you and Teller to rub butts instead of a handshake?
3) Favorite horror flick?
4) Favorite Three Stooges movie?
You should start a subreddit in which models pose and let other Redditors photoshop and paint them.
3.5) What do homeless people ask for?

WRITING.TITLE: Got really baked [8] and had this thought
WRITING.TEXT:
Is this life that I am currently living truly real or is it a fantasy realm created by my imagination? Lately I've felt like it's just been some sort of landslide that I just so happen to be caught up in and the reality of it is that there is no escape. At night, with eyes wide open, I look up into the clouds and stars above and all I seem to see is how broke and childish I am, but I am not asking for any sympathy. Like the saying goes, "Easy come, easy go." Some days are a little bit higher than others, but some are just a little bit lower. I guess all I'm trying to say is that whatever the direction the wind is blowing, it doesn't really matter to me. To me.
Told you I was high....none of this makes any sense.
Have a great day!
That made me tear up with laughs. Nice burn.

I also have pics of the Cotton Bowl and all others sides, but this was my favorite
I meant to say I was AT the State Fair and the Perfect View was the Dallas skyline with the Big Wheel and sunshine.
Nope. End. And I'm Atheist. Have a great day!
AtheistCowboy
Totally worth the 14 tickets.

WRITING.TITLE: Let's give Greenville Avenue Pizza Company some Super Bowl love!!!!
WRITING.TEXT:
Greenville Avenue Pizza Company is entered in a contest that gives them a chance to have a commercial at the 2014 Super Bowl!!! Below is a link and within 3 clicks (click the link, click the video and watch, click to vote) you can get them closer to their dream. I went to high school with Sammy Mandell (owner) and his wife (Molly) and he/she are the coolest and nicest people you will ever meet. Don't believe me? Go to CAPC and find out. But for now, click the link and let's get a Dallas restaurant on the TV during the SUPER BOWL!!!!!!!

If I had a theme song, it would be "Lenny" (even though I'm a Johnny). Every time I hear that track, it makes me smile. It's a simple track but it's that simplicity that really helps me enjoy the day. With that being said, "Riviera Paradise" is one of the world's greatest songs ever.

Austin glorifies him like we should be doing. Down there, he's a legend. Most people from here in Dallas dont even know he's from here. Why doesn't he have a street named after him? It's ridiculous. I love the shit out of Dallas, no hate, but Austin loves him more than us.
Why Dallas doesn't embrace this legend like Austin does, I will never know.
